title: Cane River Creole National Historical Park: People
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People               People         Cane River residents attending the horse races at Magnolia Plantation. NPS-CARI Image  Genesis of a Culture A vital branch of the New World culture we know as Creole took root in the rich soil along Cane river in 18th-century Louisiana. It was a culture nurtured by French and Spanish colonial ways, steeped in Africanisms, and enriched by American Indian contact. To learn more about these specific groups, clink on the links below.       French Spanish  Africans American Indians
